Articles.Content:
My Asteroidal RCS has a problem.

Four of these thruster blocks:

are anchored to an asteroid. There's also a fuel tanker, and a control craft docked on two remaining sides.

The problem is these thruster blocks have only tiny token tanks that were needed to maneuver them into place - and they don't draw fuel from the tanker.

I'd consider attaching KAS ports to these tanks (there's a little bit visible between the Klaw and the 6-way hub), and drawing pipes from the tanker - but I'm worried it won't work. Transferring fuel all the time manually would be way too bothersome (I need IVA view from the control craft to be really in control of the maneuvers).

How to keep these tanks filled - or the engines supplied with fuel otherwise? Would the Fuel Balancer mod help, or something similar like it?

Edited September 1, 2016 by Sharpy

You can set the pipe ends to continually pump to that point and never worry about it again.

1 minute ago, Palaceviking said:

KAS is awesome for things like this.

You can set the pipe ends to continually pump to that point and never worry about it again. 

How do I do it? I've installed KAS but it only offers plug mode, extend, retract, and so on. I've seen people setting up weird stuff with KAS, like some big, thick pipes, or connect ports without a winch, or such, but I have no clue how to do this. I don't seem to have the necessary parts at all. Some KAS extension?

If you put two connector ports and an electric screwdriver in an engineers inventory in the vab(any probs just ask) then when said engineer gets there

1:open inventory-equip screwdriver-

2:attach ports to any two points.(you might want to carry quite a few of these actually) 

3:right click on a port and click link, then you will see a green translucent pipe attached to the port and your kerbals back.

4: go to other port-right click-attach.

5:switch back to the craft and right click on one of the ports-select "pump here".

Any probs post here I'll follow this thread. 

Also I found out that stuff in their inventory makes them much heavier (proved difficult when I had to reassemble a lander on duna and my jetpack became useless)!

right click on one of the ports-select "pump here"

Hm, interesting.  I don't remember seeing that, but it's been a while since I played a KAS game.  Is that a recently-added feature?

Also, why would such a "pump here" feature even be needed?  Connected is connected, yes?  Wouldn't they just draw fuel from wherever they need it?
